resize

public static byte[] resize(byte[] array,
                            int length)
Re-sizes an array to the specified size. If the new size is smaller, elements get truncated. If the new size if bigger, the new array will have several null-valued elements near its end (i.e. newSize-oldSize in count). If the sizes are equal, the same array is returned.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Array is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Length is out of range

sequenceEqual

public static boolean sequenceEqual(byte[] a,
                                    byte[] b)
Returns true if the byte sequences within two arrays are equal. Also returns true if both arrays are null. Returns false if only one array is null.
